main event: A round, white object with a diameter of 120 feet was observed by ground-radar and air-intercept radar near Minot, North Dakota on July 27, 1957.
interesting points: The object was traveling at a very high speed, stopping and starting at increasing distance.
The characteristics of the object were similar to those of a weather balloon.
The observer noted that it was 'very likely' the object was a weather balloon.
The observer was unable to get a timetable for a Russian Earth satellite, and the cause of the sighting remained unknown.
sighted object: round, white object with a diameter of 120 feet
